website_summaries.verdict: The HTC One Max has a display big-screened phone shoppers want, but the Samsung Galaxy Note 3's superior design and display make it a better buy.
pros: The HTC One Max has a massive screen that's bright, colorful, and sharp
The camera is packed with features and takes pictures quickly, plus the phone has a powerful set of stereo speakers
cons: The HTC One Max is large and heavy and the integrated fingertip reader often fails to recognize finger swipes
The phone's battery is not removable either, and the One Max's components don't match its high price

customer_reviews.title: Yasss Huntee!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this phone because my old one had had it. The phone arrived faster than expected (thank goodness) and has given me zero issues since having it. It's a little bit more set up involved, switching from Samsung but a small free downloaded app got me right together. I've gotten a lot of compliments and have convinced friends that buying this phone is a worthwhile investment. The antenna on this phone is a bit rough,I notice I have more dead zones than with my other phone although I'm with the same carrier. But a beautiful screen display, loud speakers, and a camera fit for any picture lover makes this phone a winner in my book.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Williams

customer_reviews.title: GREAT GREAT WONDERFUL
customer_reviews.text: Wow, I cant believe I forgot to write a review for my HTC ONE Max. I LOVE IT! I have never had a problem AT ALL! As a matter of fact, I am about to purchase my husband one next week..from this SAME SELLER!!!! I cant wait to surprise him, our 6th year Anniversary is next month, and he'll get THIS phone!! and yea..its unlocked! I have Straight Talk (prepaid) on my phone. You guys CANT LOOSE w/this phone from THIS seller!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ... away from over priced contracts and it has not disappointed me at all
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to get away from over priced contracts and it has not disappointed me at all. I tried metropcs 4G service 1st and it is wonderful but I travel a lot and the coverage locally is great. Coverage on highways and interstates is awful. Now i'm on cricket 4G service which is slower in my area but the coverage is great. So you have both options they both can give you 4g service its the coverage in your area that should make the difference.
customer_reviews.author: shine collins

customer_reviews.title: This is a pretty nice phone - heavy
customer_reviews.text: This is a pretty nice phone - heavy, but with a really big screen and decent battery life. That said, the seller is not being clear about the status of the phones. The devices may be unlocked but they have carrier apps installed on them. The one we bought is Verizon branded, which was not indicated anywhere in the product description. That is unfortunate, since we use T-Mobile and the phone is not working correctly. The voice mail is not working and is apparently not fixable. It took quite a bit of work on my part to get incoming calls to work correctly. After many hours talking to T-Mobile customer care, the phone is not very useful.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The BEST PHONE I HAVE EVER HAD
customer_reviews.text: I will say this would be the best phone that I have ever had. Since I bought this phone in 2014 and is still working great in 2017. It is the best phone I have ever had Anyone looking for a phone should buy this phone. Only problem i have is the power botton went out. It started to go out in the start of Jan. 2017

customer_reviews.title: Love it love it love it!!!
customer_reviews.text: This device is no less than awesome!!! Beautiful big screen, fastest performance, neat Sense 5.5 interface, premium aluminium design, long battery life despite it's sealed and irremovable, stereo loud speakers in the front, fingerprint scanner which is a cool feature doesn't work every time though - in that case you need a backup pin code. No stylus pen included but one can purchase separately and fetch it some place (no dedicated holder), The main issue is the overall weight - about 217 gr. and the screen size may not fit to everyone, depends on your hand shape and your ability to maneuver as most actions would require 2 hands use. Otherwise - this is simply the best for this year!

customer_reviews.title: One nice feature gone
customer_reviews.text: The phone looks good. I purchased it as a gift and unfortunately it didn't arrive before the individual left. I have the M8 and I love it. This phone is missing one of the key features that I love about my M8. This phone doesn't have the feature that allows you to toggle between previously opened screens. You can only go to the home screen and back. That was stupid of the designers to take that feature out especially when the Samsung phones offer that feature. If you want to compete with Samsung you can't just increase the size of your phone, you also have to include nice features.

customer_reviews.title: This is an Awesome phone
customer_reviews.text: I loved my HTC One M7 but wanted a bigger screen so I ordered the Max. Totally worth it! This is unlocked and works perfectly with my At&t service at LTE speed. Someone mentioned that this wasn't possible on a previous review but that was totally untrue. I did a speed test and even with 1 bar down I was getting 15mb download speed on LTE and the browsing and social media use was really fast at this rate. I literally just popped in the same Micro sim I was using with my M7 and it worked no issue. Get this if you loved the M7, you won't be disappointed.

product_meta.title: HTC One Max 32GB 4G LTE Unlocked GSM Android Smartphone - Silver
product_meta.description: Maximize everything. Massive screen and amped speakers for movies that sizzle. Feature-rich camera gives you artistic photo flair, and home screen posts connect you to real-time news. All powered by our biggest battery to fuel the most demanding user. Introducing the HTC One max: more screen size, more camera, more everything.
feature_bullets: 32GB, 2GB RAM + microSD Slot Expansion up to 64GB
Qualcomm Snapdragon 600 Processor; Quad-core 1.7 GHz Krait 300
5.9" Super LCD3 Multi-Touchscreen w/ Fingerprint Sensor, Corning Gorilla Glass 3 and HTC Sense 5.5
